verses.roman:
cakṣus tvaṣṭari saṁyojya
tvaṣṭāram api cakṣuṣi
māṁ tatra manasā dhyāyan
viśvaṁ paśyati dūrataḥ

synonyms: cakṣuḥ—the eyes; tvaṣṭari—in the sun; saṁyojya—merging; tvaṣṭāram—the sun; api—also; cakṣuṣi—in one's eyes; mām—Me; tatra—there, in the mutual merging of sun and eye; manasā—with the mind; dhyāyan—meditating; viśvam—everything; paśyati—he sees; dūrataḥ—far away.
translation: Merging one's sight into the sun planet and then the sun planet into one's eyes, one should meditate on Me as existing within the combination of sun and vision; thus one acquires the power to see any distant thing.
